title: Learnership Tax Allowances
status: Extended - No sunset clause (was April 1, 2024, now extended)
description: Tax deduction for employers who enter into registered learnership agreements to encourage skills development and employment

employer: Agreement registered with relevant SETA (Sector Education and Training Authority)
Must derive income from trade where learnership is conducted
Learnership must be pursuant to trade carried on by employer
learner: Must be party to registered learnership agreement
Agreement must be registered before 1 April 2024 (for old rates)

annual_allowance.description: Deductible annually while learnership is active

nqf_1_to_6.calculation: Pro-rated based on months learner participated (full months only)

nqf_7_to_10.calculation: Pro-rated based on months learner participated (full months only)

completion_allowance.description: Once-off allowance upon successful completion of learnership

duration_multiplier.under_24_months: Full allowance claimed in completion year
duration_multiplier.over_24_months: Allowance multiplied by number of consecutive 12-month periods

calculation_examples.scenario: Manufacturing company with 10 learners (NQF 1-6, able-bodied) completing 12-month learnership
Tech company with 5 learners (NQF 7-10, able-bodied) completing 18-month learnership
Employer with learner starting mid-year (6 months participation)
calculation_examples.notes: Pro-rated to actual months of participation in tax year

documentation_required.proof_of_completion: Certificate from relevant SETA or training provider
documentation_required.learner_details: ID number, disability status, NQF level

common_mistakes: Claiming before SETA registration is complete
Not pro-rating for partial year participation

financial_impact_sa.market_opportunity: Estimated R2+ billion unclaimed annually across SA SMEs
